alert.note: Alert for Wise (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 8:27AM CDT until August 22 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Jack and Wise. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Decatur, Bridgeport, Jacksboro, Briar, Springtown, Alvord, Boyd, Chico, Bryson, Paradise, Boonsville, Cottondale, Runaway Bay and Lake Bridgeport.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
